questions.question: 1. Identify the symbol for NAND gate.

explanations.a: Correct. This symbol represents a NAND Gate.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This symbol represents a buffer Gate.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This symbol represents a NOT Gate.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This symbol represents an AND Gate.

questions.question: 2. Identify the symbol for NOR gate.

explanations.a: Incorrect. This symbol represents an AND Gate.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This symbol represents a NAND Gate.
explanations.c: Correct. This symbol represents a NOR Gate.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This symbol represents an OR Gate.

questions.question: 3. What is the correct representation (in terms of switches) for two n-devices connected in series having inputs 0 & 1?

explanations.a: Incorrect. This symbol represents two n-devices connected in series having inputs 0 & 0. An n-device having input 1 acts like a closed switch and that having input 0 acts like an open switch.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This symbol represents two n-devices connected in series having inputs 1 & 0. An n-device having input 1 acts like a closed switch and that having input 0 acts like an open switch.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This symbol represents two n-devices connected in series having inputs 1 & 1. An n-device having input 1 acts like a closed switch and that having input 0 acts like an open switch.
explanations.d: Correct. This symbol represents two n-devices connected in series having inputs 0 & 1. An n-device having input 1 acts like a closed switch and that having input 0 acts like an open switch.

questions.question: 4. What is the correct representation (in terms of switches) for two p-devices connected in series having both inputs as 1?

explanations.a: Incorrect. This shows two p-devices connected in series with both inputs as 0. A p-device having input 0 acts like a closed switch, so both switches are closed in series.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This shows two p-devices connected in series with inputs 0 & 1. A p-device having input 0 acts like a closed switch and input 1 acts like an open switch.
explanations.c: Correct. This shows the correct representation for two p-devices connected in series with both inputs as 1. A p-device having input 1 acts like an open switch, so both switches are open in series.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This option indicates that none of the diagrams correctly represent the scenario described in the question.

questions.question: 5. Which of the following Boolean expressions is represented by the given Karnaugh map?

explanations.a: Correct. The Karnaugh map shows that the output is 1 when B=1, regardless of the value of A. This simplifies to just B.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This would mean the output depends only on A, but the K-map shows it depends on B.
explanations.c: Incorrect. A+B (A OR B) would be 1 when either A or B is 1, which doesn't match the given K-map pattern.
explanations.d: Incorrect. AB (A AND B) would only be 1 when both A and B are 1, which doesn't match the K-map.

questions.question: 6 Which of the following Boolean expressions is represented by the given Karnaugh map?

explanations.a: Incorrect. AB would only depend on variables A and B, but this K-map involves three variables A, B, and C.
explanations.b: Incorrect. BC would only be 1 when both B and C are 1, which doesn't match the pattern shown in the K-map.
explanations.c: Correct. The Karnaugh map shows that the output is 1 when both A and C are 1, regardless of the value of B. This simplifies to AC.
explanations.d: Incorrect. ABC would only be 1 when all three variables A, B, and C are 1, which is more restrictive than what the K-map shows.
